title: A good pun is its own reword
summary:
Key ideas
- A good pun requires something more than just using two words that sound alike.
- Some puns achieve greatness by the sheer variety of meanings.
- Others are phrases of a few words, all of which get punned at the same time.
- Some puns are great because they start a chain reaction among parts of speech that shifts around entire sentence structures.
- Still other puns require a lot of background knowledge to work.

Key learnings
- A truly great pun requires creativity and linguistic skill.
- Puns can take on many forms, including wordplay, multiple meanings, and grammar.
- Some puns require a deeper understanding of language and culture to appreciate fully.

Key questions
- What is the difference between a good pun and a truly great pun?
- What are some different forms a pun can take?
- Why do some puns require background knowledge to understand?
